explains: n. 虚假，不真实；假话，谎言；说谎；谬误

sentences.en: She called the verdict a victory of truth over falsehood.
sentences.cn: 她称该裁定是一个真实对虚假的胜利。

sentences.en: When people uttered a falsehood, the scientists noticed a burst of activity in their amygdala.
sentences.cn: 当人们说假话时，科学家们注意到他们的杏仁核会突然活跃起来。

sentences.en: Not only that, but when people faced no consequences for dishonesty, their falsehood tended to get even more sensational.
sentences.cn: 不仅如此，当人们的不诚实不会造成后果，他们的谎言往往就会变得更加耸人听闻。
